workflow.name: Notify on Discord about new Epic Games free game releases
workflow.description:
# Description
Very straightforward workflow. It checks the Epic Games website if the HTML container with free games has changed. If it did then it will send a notification to Discord with a list of embeds containing those games.

# Requirements
- You will need to install `n8n-nodes-puppeteer` community node

# Setup
There are two nodes that notify Discord. One at the very end and one in the loop in case of error. Configure them with a webhook or a bot, whatever suits you. That's all.

parameters.content: Failed to check Epic Games for new content

nodes.name: GET Epic Games Free Games page

parameters.content:
For some reason sometimes this can return whole page properly but the container with free games is empty. So we repeat few times.

Requires `n8n-nodes-puppeteer` to be installed. Otherwise you get blocked by Cloudflare.
This can sometimes fail so it will repeat few times.
Save only when we are sure user got notification.
Keeps a 'hash' of changes so that it knows if anything changed between executions.
If the workflow does not work this is most likely the point of failure. It means that they have changed something on their page and css selector has changed.

The notification on Discord consists of Embeds. 
The Template looks like this:

### Epic Games
New games detected
```
 ______________________
| GAME 1     [ IMAGE ] |
| Free Now   [       ] |
|______________________|
 ______________________
| GAME 2     [ IMAGE ] |
| Free Now   [       ] |
|______________________|
 ______________________
| GAME 3     [ IMAGE ] |
| Coming Soon[       ] |
|______________________|
```

main.node: GET Epic Games Free Games page

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
